creator: blizzy-keyword-apache_bugs.e23ed5@blizzy.de
text:
Trying to log an Exception using log.debug(ex) results in not printing a stack
trace. You have to use the two-argument version debug(Object, Throwable) to get
a stack trace.

Actually, I think this is a little cumbersome since all I need is the stack
trace. It would look quite ugly in the code if I had to write log.debug("", ex)
everywhere.

I suggest adding a method debug(Throwable) that prints the Throwable's stack trace.

(The same goes for all other logging levels.)

creator: ceki@apache.org
text:
Hello Maik,

This is a well known log4j behaviour. Altough surprising in the beginning, one 
gets used to it quite quickly. Moreover, a message explaining the context for 
the stack trace is usually welcome. Consequently, there is no intention to add 
a debug( Throwable) method.
